children.value: Provides a unified API for subscribing to events about both basic input events (e.g. 'mousemove', 'touchstart', 'wheel') and gestural input (e.g. 'click', 'tap', 'panstart').
While EventManager supports mouse and touch events, we recommend the use of
when possible for the broadest input device compatibility.
{DOM Element, optional} - DOM element on which event handlers will be registered. Default
{Object} - Map of {event name: handler} to register on init.
- {Object} Gesture recognizers from Hammer.js to register, as an Array in
. If not provided, a default set of recognizers will be used. See "Gesture Events" section below for more details.
. Keys are recognizer names and values are recognizer options. For a list of default recognizers, see "Gesture Events" section below.
- {Boolean} Recognizes click and drag from pressing the right mouse button. Default
. If turned on, the context menu will be disabled.
- {String} Allow browser default touch actions. Default
- {Boolean} Blocks default page scroll behavior on wheel events. Default
to enable scrolling. This option is for backward compatibility and will be removed in the next major release.
Tears down internal event management implementations.
Note: It is important to call
Set the DOM element on which event handlers will be registered. If element has been set, events will be unregistered from the previous element.
{DOM Element, optional} - DOM element on which event handlers will be registered.
Register an event handler function to be called on
) or map of event names to handlers.
{Function} - The function to be called on

{Node} - The source element of this event. If provided, only events that are targeting this element or its decendants will invoke the handler. If ignored, default to the whole document. Events are propagated up the DOM tree.
** Note: Unlike the DOM event system, developers are responsible of deregistering event handlers when
Register a one-time event handler function to be called on
. The handler is removed once it has been called.
) or map of event names to handlers.
{Function} - The function to be called on

{Node} - The source element of this event. If provided, only events that are targeting this element or its decendants will invoke the handler. If ignored, default to the whole document. Events are propagated up the DOM tree.
{string|Object} - An event name (String) or map of event names to handlers
{Function} - The function to be called on
Keyboard events are fired when focus is on the EventManager's target element or its decendants, unless typing into a text input.
Mouse event and pointer event names are interchangeable.

currently uses Hammer.js for gesture and touch support, but Hammer.js does not support all input event types out of the box. Therefore,
employs the following modules to shim the missing functionality:
Handles pointer/touch/mouse move events while no button pressed, and leave events (for when the cursor leaves the DOM element registered with

Handles mouse wheel events and trackpad events that emulate mouse wheel events. Note that this module is stateful: it tracks time elapsed between events in order to determine the magnitude/scroll distance of an event.

Current implementation delegates touch and gesture event registration and handling to Hammer.js. Includes shims for handling event not supported by Hammer.js, such as keyboard input, mouse move, and wheel input. This dependency structure may change in the future.
, and so will fail in environments without these constructs (e.g. Node). To mitigate this, Hammer.js modules are conditionally
d, and replaced with mocks in non-browser environments.
